summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) discussing a Fox News inquiry about the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondents debate whether to comment on a claim that there are no photos of Epstein's body in his cell, ultimately leaning toward declining to comment.

events.title: 60 Minutes piece on Epstein's death
events.description: A "60 Minutes" segment aired discussing the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death, framing it as a "murder."

events.title: Fox News inquiry about Epstein body photos
events.description: Fox News contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York asking for comment on the claim that there are no photos of Epstein's body in his cell.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from January 6, 2020, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
It references a Fox News inquiry prompted by a "60 Minutes" segment that aired the previous night, which discussed Epstein's death as a "murder."
The specific inquiry asks for comment on the claim that "there are no photos of Epstein's body in his cell."
The email chain shows internal deliberation, with the correspondents leaning toward declining to comment on the matter.
The document indicates ongoing media and public interest in the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
